parameters.description: The caller is required to set Avi Version Header to the expected version of configuration. The response from the controller will provide and accept data according to the specified version. The controller will reject POST and PUT requests where the data is not compatible with the specified version.
parameters.name: X-Avi-Version

parameters.description: Avi Controller may send back CSRF token in the response cookies. The caller should update the request headers with this token else controller will reject requests.
parameters.name: X-CSRFToken

parameters.description: All the Avi REST reference URIs have a name suffix as URI#name. It is useful to get the referenced resource name without performing get on that object.
parameters.name: include_name

parameters.description: Default values are not set.

parameters.description: It automatically returns additional dependent resources like runtime. Eg. join_subresources=runtime.

parameters.description: Filter to request all objects that refers to another Avi resource. Its syntax is refers_to=<obj_type>:<obj_uuid>. Eg. get all virtual services referring to pool p1 will be refers_to=pool:pool_p1_uuid
parameters.name: refers_to

parameters.description: Filter to request all objects that are referred by another Avi resource. Its syntax is referred_by=<obj_type>:<obj_uuid>. Eg. get all pools referred_by virtual service vs1 - referred_by=virtualservice:vs_vs1_uuid
parameters.name: referred_by

parameters.description: List of fields to be returned for the resource. Some fields like name, URL, uuid etc. are always returned.
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: All the Avi REST reference URIs have a name suffix as URI#name. It is useful to get the referenced resource name without performing get on that object.
parameters.name: include_name

parameters.description: Default values are not set.
parameters.name: skip_default

parameters.description: It automatically returns additional dependent resources like runtime. Eg. join_subresources=runtime.

parameters.name: X-CSRFToken

parameters.description: Filter to get objects that belongs to a specific cloud using its uuid. Eg. cloud_uuid=cloud-xyz.
parameters.name: cloud_uuid

parameters.description: Filter to get objects that belongs to a specific cloud usings its name. This uses cloud name rather than uuid. Eg. cloud_ref.name=Default-Cloud.
parameters.name: cloud_ref.name

file.description: Placeholder for description of property file of obj type FailActionHTTPLocalResponse field type str  type object

implicit_priority_labels.description: Whether an implicit set of priority labels is generated. Field introduced in 17.1.9,17.2.3.

members.description: List of pool group members object of type PoolGroupMember.

fail_action.description: Enable an action - Close Connection, HTTP Redirect, or Local HTTP Response - when a pool group failure happens. By default, a connection will be closed, in case the pool group experiences a failure.

service_metadata.description: Metadata pertaining to the service provided by this PoolGroup. In Openshift/Kubernetes environments, app metadata info is stored. Any user input to this field will be overwritten by Avi Vantage. Field introduced in 17.2.14,18.1.5,18.2.1.

name.description: The name of the pool group.

_last_modified.description: UNIX time since epoch in microseconds. Units(MICROSECONDS).

priority_labels_ref.description: UUID of the priority labels. If not provided, pool group member priority label will be interpreted as a number with a larger number considered higher priority. It is a reference to an object of type PriorityLabels.

cloud_ref.description: It is a reference to an object of type Cloud.

tenant_ref.description: It is a reference to an object of type Tenant.

created_by.description: Name of the user who created the object.

cloud_config_cksum.description: Checksum of cloud configuration for PoolGroup. Internally set by cloud connector.

min_servers.description: The minimum number of servers to distribute traffic to. Allowed values are 1-65535. Special values are 0 - 'Disable'.

deployment_policy_ref.description: When setup autoscale manager will automatically promote new pools into production when deployment goals are met. It is a reference to an object of type PoolGroupDeploymentPolicy.

priority_label.description: All pools with same label are treated similarly in a pool group. A pool with a higher priority is selected, as long as the pool is eligible or an explicit policy chooses a different pool.

deployment_state.description: Pool deployment state used with the PG deployment policy. Enum options - EVALUATION_IN_PROGRESS, IN_SERVICE, OUT_OF_SERVICE, EVALUATION_FAILED.

pool_ref.description: UUID of the pool. It is a reference to an object of type Pool.

ratio.description: Ratio of selecting eligible pools in the pool group. . Allowed values are 1-1000. Special values are 0 - 'Do not select this pool for new connections'.

backup_pool_ref.description: Specifies the UUID of the Pool acting as backup pool. It is a reference to an object of type Pool.

backup_pool.description: Backup Pool when pool experiences a failure. Field deprecated in 18.1.2.

redirect.description: URL to redirect HTTP requests to when pool experiences a failure.

local_rsp.description: Local response to HTTP requests when pool experiences a failure.

type.description: Enables a response to client when pool experiences a failure. By default TCP connection is closed. Enum options - FAIL_ACTION_HTTP_REDIRECT, FAIL_ACTION_HTTP_LOCAL_RSP, FAIL_ACTION_CLOSE_CONN, FAIL_ACTION_BACKUP_POOL.

file_content.description: File content to used in the local HTTP response body.

content_type.description: Mime-type of the content in the file.
